intro: Oreogenia paulsenii, commonly known as the Paulsen's oreogen, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white, and it produces small, triangular fruits. Oreogenia paulsenii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
